conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the copper rod when energized in a magnetic field.
Forces include gravitational force, tension in wires, and magnetic force due to current.
When rod is not energized, gravitational force and tension in wires are in equilibrium: 2T = mg.
When rod is energized, magnetic force acts vertically upwards, tension in wires is 1/4 of original.
Forces when energized: mg downwards, magnetic force upwards, tension 1/2 T upwards.
Equilibrium when energized: mg = F_B + 1/2 T.
Magnetic force F_B is given by F_B = BIL.
Substitute F_B = BIL and 2T = mg into equilibrium equation: mg = BIL + 1/2 T.
Determine current direction using right-hand rule: current flows from M to N.
